channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Are There Mistakes In Jazz?
item.description: What is a mistake? By going through examples with his improvisational jazz quartet, Stefon Harris gets to a profound truth: many actions are perceived as mistakes only because we don't react to them appropriately.
item.content:encoded:
What is a mistake? By going through examples with his improvisational jazz quartet, Stefon Harris gets to a profound truth: many actions are perceived as mistakes only because we don't react to them appropriately.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: 10 Great Album Art Fake-Outs
item.description: In honor of The Strokes' new album, Comedown Machine, packaged behind a cover meant to look like a 1970s tape-reel box, here's a selection of other albums packaged inside materials that refer to another musical format of some kind.
item.content:encoded:
In honor of The Strokes' new album, Comedown Machine, packaged behind a cover meant to look like a 1970s tape-reel box, here's a selection of other albums packaged inside materials that refer to another musical format of some kind.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Gashcat: NPR Front Row
item.description: The Louisiana-based band Gashcat makes fantastically catchy, idiosyncratic rock and pop songs bursting with joy. We first heard the group at the 2012 South by Southwest music festival. But Gashcat returned to Austin in 2013 to give another thrilling, all-too-short performance.
item.content:encoded:
The Louisiana-based band Gashcat makes fantastically catchy, idiosyncratic rock and pop songs bursting with joy. We first heard the group at the 2012 South by Southwest music festival. But Gashcat returned to Austin in 2013 to give another thrilling, all-too-short performance.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Marches Madness: Spielberg's Symphonist
item.description: As Hollywood grew increasingly computerized, one man stuck to his Romantic guns. Thanks to John Williams, aliens, wizards, dinosaurs and even humans have cruised across the screen to his sweeping, richly scored orchestral melodies. See Williams conduct the jolly march from the comedy 1941.
item.content:encoded:
As Hollywood grew increasingly computerized, one man stuck to his Romantic guns. Thanks to John Williams, aliens, wizards, dinosaurs and even humans have cruised across the screen to his sweeping, richly scored orchestral melodies. See Williams conduct the jolly march from the comedy 1941.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: VHÖL Runs Off The Rails, 'Insane With Faith'
item.description: Members of Agalloch, YOB, and Hammers of Misfortune form this raw and adventurous metal band. But VHÖL's self-titled debut is a thunderous album that doesn't sound like the sum of its parts.
item.content:encoded:
Members of Agalloch, YOB, and Hammers of Misfortune form this raw and adventurous metal band. But VHÖL's self-titled debut is a thunderous album that doesn't sound like the sum of its parts.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: They Drive At 55: The Monterey Jazz Anniversary Tour
item.description: The Monterey Jazz Festival is celebrating 55 years of swinging with a coastal California vibe. An all-star sextet is crossing the country, advancing the festival's mission: to create and support jazz education and performance programs. JazzSet has highlights from the Kennedy Center.
item.content:encoded:
The Monterey Jazz Festival is celebrating 55 years of swinging with a coastal California vibe. An all-star sextet is crossing the country, advancing the festival's mission: to create and support jazz education and performance programs. JazzSet has highlights from the Kennedy Center.

item.title: Billy Cobham On World Cafe
item.description: Hear the pioneering jazz drummer talk about his 40th-anniversary tour and working with Miles Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Hear the pioneering jazz drummer talk about his 40th-anniversary tour and working with Miles Davis.

item.title: The Good Friday 5: Musical Passion Stories You Must Hear
item.description: Before Easter, hear five powerful and diverse musical portrayals of Jesus' last days and crucifixion, from Bach's monumental St. Matthew to Golijov's brilliant Latin American mashup to a dark and terrifying Russian vision from Sofia Gubaidulina.
item.content:encoded:
Before Easter, hear five powerful and diverse musical portrayals of Jesus' last days and crucifixion, from Bach's monumental St. Matthew to Golijov's brilliant Latin American mashup to a dark and terrifying Russian vision from Sofia Gubaidulina.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Emmylou Harris And Rodney Crowell: Harmonizing To That 'Old Yellow Moon'
item.description: Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell have been friends and collaborators since they first met in 1974. While they always wanted to make an album together, they never got around to it until now. Old Yellow Moon includes songs by Crowell, Patti Scialfa, Johnny Cash, and Kris Kristofferson among others.
item.content:encoded:
Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell have been friends and collaborators since they first met in 1974. While they always wanted to make an album together, they never got around to it until now. Old Yellow Moon includes songs by Crowell, Patti Scialfa, Johnny Cash, and Kris Kristofferson among others.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Fresh Flavor For Your Ears: 7 New Latin Songs
item.description: This week on Alt.Latino, we do what we do best: share our favorite new music with you. Portuguese fado, Brazilian electronic music, and a brand new Chicano anthem.
item.content:encoded:
This week on Alt.Latino, we do what we do best: share our favorite new music with you. Portuguese fado, Brazilian electronic music, and a brand new Chicano anthem.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Train To Glory: A Gospel Music Mix
item.description: With Easter upon us, Cecilia Webb — host of Train to Glory on KUNM in Albuquerque, N.M. — takes us on a tour of the contemporary gospel music scene. For a limited time, listen to a continuous mix that touches on all corners of her collection.
item.content:encoded:
With Easter upon us, Cecilia Webb — host of Train to Glory on KUNM in Albuquerque, N.M. — takes us on a tour of the contemporary gospel music scene. For a limited time, listen to a continuous mix that touches on all corners of her collection.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Caravan Of Thieves On Mountain Stage
item.description: Formed around the duo of Fuzz and Carrie Sangiovanni, the band brings its unique fusion of Gypsy jazz, swing and pop to Mountain Stage for the first time. This diverse set includes a surprisingly faithful cover of Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody."
item.content:encoded:
Formed around the duo of Fuzz and Carrie Sangiovanni, the band brings its unique fusion of Gypsy jazz, swing and pop to Mountain Stage for the first time. This diverse set includes a surprisingly faithful cover of Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody."

item.title: The Good News Is That We Know 'Idol' Is Really Live Now
item.description: A particularly meandering performance of "I Can't Help Myself" left a sour taste from Motown Night.
item.content:encoded:
A particularly meandering performance of "I Can't Help Myself" left a sour taste from Motown Night.

item.title: We Get Mail: The Power Of Pulling The Plug
item.description: Why do some songs just sound better when you strip away all of the frills?
item.content:encoded:
Why do some songs just sound better when you strip away all of the frills?

item.title: The Many Sounds Of 1993 Bay Area Rap
item.description: Overlooked by the industry, Bay Area rappers as different as E-40, Too Short and The Coup were free to make and sell music that didn't sound like anybody else's.
item.content:encoded:
Overlooked by the industry, Bay Area rappers as different as E-40, Too Short and The Coup were free to make and sell music that didn't sound like anybody else's.
